intro: Cupania tepuiensis, commonly known as the tepui cupania, is a flowering plant native to the tepuis of South America, particularly in Venezuela and Guyana. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endemic species, often found in cloud forests at high altitudes.
